name: Musical Questions: Oldies Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who sang "Have I the right to hold you?"
questions.explanation:
The Honeycombs.

	"Have I the right?" was a hit for the British group of Honey and the Honeycombs. It was their first hit - and their most popular song.

questions.text: Who sang "How would I know? Why should I care?"
questions.explanation:
Zombies.

	The questions come from "She's Not There". This big hit for the Zombies was followed by "Tell Her No".

Buckinghams.

	This was the title of the follow-up song to the popular "Kind of a Drag". It didn't do nearly as well.

questions.text: Who sang "Why pretend you've somewhere else to go?"
questions.explanation:
Petula Clark.

	The line comes from Pet Clark's "Don't Sleep in the Subway".

questions.text: Who sang "What makes you think love will end?"
questions.explanation:
Association.

	The Association followed "Cherish" with "Never, My Love". This line comes from the latter song.

questions.text: Who sang "Why is she holding his hand?"
questions.explanation:
Lesley Gore.

	"Why is she holding his hand when he's supposed to be mine"? comes from "It's My Party?" (which was followed up by "Judy's Turn To Cry").

questions.text: Who sang "Would you have my baby?"
questions.explanation:
Bobby Darin.

	"If I were a carpenter and you were a lady" is the preceding line. It was a hit for Darin.

questions.text: Who sang "How do you do it?"
questions.explanation:
Gerry and the Pacemakers.

	An early hit for Gerry and his group asked "How Do You Do What You Do To Me?"

questions.text: Who sang "Hey, girl can't you remember?"
questions.explanation:
Four Seasons.

	The line comes from "Ronnie": "Hey girl, can't you remember and want more from me?"

questions.text: Which is NOT by the Beatles?
questions.explanation:
All are by the Beatles.

	"I'm looking through you, what did I know?" comes from "I'm Looking Through You". "Why am I so shy when I'm beside you?" comes from "It's Only Love". "What have I done to deserve such a fate?" comes from "I'm A Loser".
